Class StandardLivingRoom

java.lang.Object
util.Observable<LivingRoom.Event>
model.abstractModel.LivingRoom
model.StandardLivingRoom
public class StandardLivingRoom extends LivingRoom
This class is an implementation of LivingRoom

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    private void
    fillBag7(Stack<? super Tile> bag)
    fills the bag with 7 of two types of one color Tile foreach color of Tile
    private void
    fillBag8(Stack<? super Tile> bag)
    fills the bag with 8 of one type of one color Tile foreach color of Tile
    private void
    fillCenterSquare(Tile[][] board)
    this method fills the center part of the board (3x3 square) with tile form the bag if a cell is empty it is filled with a Tile removed from the bag, otherwise it is unchanged if the bag is empty it stops refilling
    private void
    fillMissingCells(Tile[][] board)
    this method fills the missing cells of the 2 player board every two cells of the pair array represents the row and column of the cells that need to be filled
    private void
    fillMissingCells3Players(Tile[][] board)
    this method fills the missing cells of the 3 player board every two cells of the pair array represents the row and column of the cells that need to be filled
    private void
    fillMissingCells4Players(Tile[][] board)
    this method fills the missing cells of the 4 player board every two cells of the pair array represents the row and column of the cells that need to be filled
    private void
    fillSideSquares(Tile[][] board, int row, int col)
    this method fills a 2x2 square of the board starting from row "row" and column "col" with tiles from the bag if a cell is empty it is filled with a Tile removed from the bag, otherwise it is unchanged if the bag is empty it stops refilling
    Stack<Tile>
    getBag()
    this method returns the game bag
    Tile[][]
    getBoard()
    this method returns a copy of the game board
    LivingRoomInfo
    getInfo()
    This method returns a LivingRoomInfo representing this object instance
    private void
    initializeBag(Stack<Tile> initialBag)
    this method loads the bag with 132 tiles using methods fillBag7(Stack) and fillBag8(Stack) and then shuffles the Tiles so that they're in random order
    private Stack<Tile>
    loadBag()
    load the game bag using initializeBag(Stack)
    private boolean
    needsToBeRefilled()
    this returns true if the board is empty and if the board is made only of "islands" of tiles (on which case the player can only pick one Tile at a time), false otherwise
    private void
    refillAlgorithm(Tile[][] board)
    this method is responsible for calling the methods needed to fill the board, namely fillCenterSquare(Tile[][]) that fills the center part of the board, always called fillSideSquares(Tile[][], int, int) (Tile[][])} that fills the squares around the center, always called fillMissingCells(Tile[][]) (Tile[][])} that fills the missing cells needed for the 2 player board, always called fillMissingCells3Players(Tile[][]) (Tile[][])} (Tile[][])} that fills the missing cells needed for the 3 player board, called if 3 players are in the game fillMissingCells4Players(Tile[][]) (Tile[][])} (Tile[][])} that fills the missing cells needed for the 4 player board, called if 4 players are in the game
    void
    refillBoard()
    refillBoard() is called before every turn if needsToBeRefilled() is true this method acquires a copy of the game board, uses the method refillAlgorithm(Tile[][]) to refill it and sets the board with this filled copy
    void
    setBoard(Tile[][] modifiedBoard)
    sets board attribute with a modified board

  • Constructor Details

    • StandardLivingRoom

      public StandardLivingRoom(int nPlayers) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Class constructor, initializes the attribute numberOfPlayer, initializes the bag and loads it with loadBag(), initializes the board with an empty board
      Parameters:
      nPlayers - the number of players for this game
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the number of player is below 2 or over 4

  • Method Details

    • getBoard

      public Tile[][] getBoard()
      this method returns a copy of the game board
      Specified by:
      getBoard in class LivingRoom
      Returns:
      a 2D array of Tiles representing the game board

    • setBoard

      public void setBoard(Tile[][] modifiedBoard)
      sets board attribute with a modified board
      Specified by:
      setBoard in class LivingRoom
      Parameters:
      modifiedBoard - a 2D array of Tiles

    • refillBoard

      public void refillBoard()
      refillBoard() is called before every turn if needsToBeRefilled() is true this method acquires a copy of the game board, uses the method refillAlgorithm(Tile[][]) to refill it and sets the board with this filled copy
      Specified by:
      refillBoard in class LivingRoom

    • getInfo

      public LivingRoomInfo getInfo()
      This method returns a LivingRoomInfo representing this object instance
      Specified by:
      getInfo in class LivingRoom
      Returns:
      An LivingRoomInfo representing this object instance

    • getBag

      public Stack<Tile> getBag()
      this method returns the game bag
      Returns:
      bag

    • loadBag

      private Stack<Tile> loadBag()
      load the game bag using initializeBag(Stack)
      Returns:
      full stack of Tiles representing the game bag

    • needsToBeRefilled

      private boolean needsToBeRefilled()
      this returns true if the board is empty and if the board is made only of "islands" of tiles (on which case the player can only pick one Tile at a time), false otherwise
      Returns:
      true or false whether the board needs to be refilled or not

    • refillAlgorithm

      private void refillAlgorithm(Tile[][] board)
      this method is responsible for calling the methods needed to fill the board, namely fillCenterSquare(Tile[][]) that fills the center part of the board, always called fillSideSquares(Tile[][], int, int) (Tile[][])} that fills the squares around the center, always called fillMissingCells(Tile[][]) (Tile[][])} that fills the missing cells needed for the 2 player board, always called fillMissingCells3Players(Tile[][]) (Tile[][])} (Tile[][])} that fills the missing cells needed for the 3 player board, called if 3 players are in the game fillMissingCells4Players(Tile[][]) (Tile[][])} (Tile[][])} that fills the missing cells needed for the 4 player board, called if 4 players are in the game
      Parameters:
      board - a 2D array of Tiles representing the game board

    • fillCenterSquare

      private void fillCenterSquare(Tile[][] board)
      this method fills the center part of the board (3x3 square) with tile form the bag if a cell is empty it is filled with a Tile removed from the bag, otherwise it is unchanged if the bag is empty it stops refilling
      Parameters:
      board - a 2D array of Tiles representing the game board

    • fillSideSquares

      private void fillSideSquares(Tile[][] board, int row, int col)
      this method fills a 2x2 square of the board starting from row "row" and column "col" with tiles from the bag if a cell is empty it is filled with a Tile removed from the bag, otherwise it is unchanged if the bag is empty it stops refilling
      Parameters:
      board - a 2D array of Tiles representing the game board
      row - starting row of square that needs to be filled
      col - starting column of square that need to be refilled

    • fillMissingCells

      private void fillMissingCells(Tile[][] board)
      this method fills the missing cells of the 2 player board every two cells of the pair array represents the row and column of the cells that need to be filled
      Parameters:
      board - a 2D array of Tiles representing the game board if a cell is empty it is filled with a Tile removed from the bag, otherwise it is unchanged

    • fillMissingCells3Players

      private void fillMissingCells3Players(Tile[][] board)
      this method fills the missing cells of the 3 player board every two cells of the pair array represents the row and column of the cells that need to be filled
      Parameters:
      board - a 2D array of Tiles representing the game board if a cell is empty it is filled with a Tile removed from the bag, otherwise it is unchanged

    • fillMissingCells4Players

      private void fillMissingCells4Players(Tile[][] board)
      this method fills the missing cells of the 4 player board every two cells of the pair array represents the row and column of the cells that need to be filled
      Parameters:
      board - a 2D array of Tiles representing the game board if a cell is empty it is filled with a Tile removed from the bag, otherwise it is unchanged

    • initializeBag

      private void initializeBag(Stack<Tile> initialBag)
      this method loads the bag with 132 tiles using methods fillBag7(Stack) and fillBag8(Stack) and then shuffles the Tiles so that they're in random order
      Parameters:
      initialBag - the stack of Tiles representing the bag

    • fillBag8

      private void fillBag8(Stack<? super Tile> bag)
      fills the bag with 8 of one type of one color Tile foreach color of Tile
      Parameters:
      bag - stack of Tiles representing the game bag

    • fillBag7

      private void fillBag7(Stack<? super Tile> bag)
      fills the bag with 7 of two types of one color Tile foreach color of Tile
      Parameters:
      bag - stack of Tiles representing the game bag
